model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.util.Observable
    Represents a Tetris board.
    Version:
    Spring 2016
    Author:
    TCSS 305 Instructors

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Default Tetris board constructor.
      Board(int theWidth, int theHeight)
      Tetris board constructor for non-default sized boards.

      Try to move the movable piece down.

      Get the height of the board.

      Get the width of the board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Default Tetris board constructor. Creates a standard size tetris game board.

      • Board

        public Board(int theWidth,
             int theHeight)
        Tetris board constructor for non-default sized boards.
        Parameters:
        theWidth - Width of the Tetris game board.
        theHeight - Height of the Tetris game board.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get the width of the board.
        Returns:
        Width of the board.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Get the height of the board.
        Returns:
        Height of the board.

      • newGame

        public void newGame()
        Resets the board for a new game. This method must be called before the first game and before each new game.

      • setPieceSequence

        public void setPieceSequence(java.util.List<TetrisPiece> thePieces)
        Sets a non random sequence of pieces to loop through.
        Parameters:
        thePieces - the List of non random TetrisPieces.

      • step

        public void step()
        Advances the board by one 'step'. This could include - moving the current piece down 1 line - freezing the current piece if appropriate - clearing full lines as needed

      • down

        public void down()
        Try to move the movable piece down. Freeze the Piece in position if down tries to move into an illegal state. Clear full lines.

      • left

        public void left()
        Try to move the movable piece left.

      • right

        public void right()
        Try to move the movable piece right.

      • rotateCW

        public void rotateCW()
        Try to rotate the movable piece in the clockwise direction.

      • rotateCCW

        public void rotateCCW()
        Try to rotate the movable piece in the counter-clockwise direction.

      • drop

        public void drop()
        Drop the piece until piece is set.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
